concept.title: ALC-IPv6-Address VSA manipulation under GXCCR context

section.title: Message manipulation for ALC-IPv6-Address VSA
section.p: The VSA ALC-IPv6-Address can be manipulated under the GXCCR context when you enable the application preference “Support Alc-IPv6-Address on Gx” to allow the Gx session to bind with the ALC-IPv6-Address. This application preference decides whether to bind Gx Session with ALC-IPv6-Address (VSA) present in CCR initial request. If this system preference's value is true and only ALC-IPv6-Address is present in the request all other IP-addresses (that is, IPv4, Framed-IPv6, and Delegated-IPv6-Prefix) are not present, then GX Session binds with ALC-IPv6-Address. Using message manipulation a rule can be authored that will add the Framed-IPv6-Prefix in the CCR that assigns the value from the “ALC-IPv6-Address” VSA. The following are rules that can be created for this type of message manipulation:
Rule to add ALC-IPv6-Address (VSA) in CCR that assigns the value from Framed-IPv6-Prefix
Rule to add Framed-IPv6-Prefix in CCR that assigns the value from ALC-IPv6-Address (VSA)
